question.title: How to deserialize different data types payloads in a single Kafka topic using Spring Cloud Stream?
question.body:
I'm building a Spring Boot application using Spring Cloud Stream with Kafka. I receive different data type messages on a single Kafka topic, but the payload can be of different types (e.g., Customer, Address, etc.) with a application/json content type.

The Kafka message contains a header like type, which indicates the event type, and the payload is in byte[].

I want to:

Deserialize the payload to the appropriate Java class based on the "type" header.

Handle all event types in a generic Spring Cloud Stream Consumer<Message<?>>.

I managed to do that using objectMapper deserialization

Customer customer = objectMapper.readValue((byte[]) customerMessage.getPayload(), Customer.class);

Address address = objectMapper.readValue((byte[]) addressMessage.getPayload(), Address.class);

And with a generic type consumer:

public class EventConsumer<T> implements Consumer<Message<T>> { 
@Override   
public void accept(final Message<T> message) {} 
}

but I want to know if there is an out of the box way to achieve that.

answers.body:
The industry-advised practice for this would not to use JSON, but instead Avro or Protobuf alongside a Schema Registry such as Confluent/Apicurio, where your consumer can be configured with a setting called RecordNameStrategy in which a referential ID is used for a schema-lookup for the deserializer, and that'll match the classes in your classpath, if needed.

https://developer.confluent.io/courses/schema-registry/schema-subjects/
